document.masterDocTitle: Unesconia coibensis, gen. et sp. nov., a miniature sponge-associated shrimp from a biodiversity hotspot in the tropical eastern Pacific (Decapoda: Palaemonidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Unesconia coibensis, gen. et sp. nov., a miniature sponge-associated shrimp from a biodiversity hotspot in the tropical eastern Pacific (Decapoda: Palaemonidae)

figureCitation.captionText-0: FIGURE 1. Unesconia coibensis gen. et sp. nov.: holotype, ovigerous female (pocl 2.0 mm, cl 3.1 mm) from Canales de Afuera, Coiba Archipelago, Panama (FLMNH UF 51926): habitus, lateral view.
figureCitation.captionText-1: FIGURE 2. Unesconia coibensis gen. et sp. nov., paratype, ovigerous female (pocl 2.1 mm, cl 3.0 mm) from Canales de Afuera, Coiba Archipelago, Panama (FLMNH UF 51928) [A–E]; holotype, ovigerous female (pocl 2.0 mm, cl 3.1 mm) from the same locality (FLMNH UF 51926) [F]; allotype, male (pocl 1.7 mm, cl 2.8 mm) from the same locality (FLMNH UF 51927) [G–I]: A—frontal region, dorsal view [left eye somewhat abnormal, i.e. smaller and partly shrunk, in the illustrated specimen (see Fig. 10B), shown as normal based on the right eye]; B—same, lateral view; C—sixth pleonite and tail fan, dorsal view; D—telson, posterior region, dorsal view; E—uropodal exopod, detail of lateral angle of diaeresis, dorsal view; F—frontal region of carapace and left eyestalk, lateral view; G—frontal region, dorsal view; H—same, lateral view; I—uropodal exopod, detail of lateral angle of diaeresis, dorsal view.

Unesconia coibensis gen. et sp. nov., paratype, ovigerous female (pocl 2.1 mm, cl 3.0 mm) from Canales de Afuera, Coiba Archipelago, Panama (FLMNH UF 51928): A—right mandible, mesial view; B—left mandible, lateral view; C—same, mesial view; D—maxillule, lateral view; E—maxilla, lateral view; F—first maxilliped, lateral view; G—second maxilliped, lateral view; H—third maxilliped, lateral view; I—epistome, ventral view.

Unesconia coibensis gen. et sp. nov., paratype, ovigerous female (pocl 2.1 mm, cl 3.0 mm) from Canales de Afuera, Coiba Archipelago, Panama (FLMNH UF 51928): A—right first pereiopod, lateral view; B—same, mesial view; C—same, chela, mesial view; D—same, chela with fingers opened, setae omitted for clarity, dorsolateral view; E—same, chela with fingers opened, setae omitted for clarity, ventromesial view.
figureCitation.captionText-4: FIGURE 5. Unesconia coibensis gen. et sp. nov., paratype, ovigerous female (pocl 2.1 mm, cl 3.0 mm) from Canales de Afuera, Coiba Archipelago, Panama (FLMNH UF 51928): A—major (left) second pereiopod, mesial (dorsal) view; B—same, carpus and chela with fingers closed, lateral (ventral) view; C—same, carpus and chela with fingers opened, lateral (ventral) view; D—same, chela fingers opened, setae omitted for clarity, lateral (ventral) view; E—minor (right) second pereiopod, lateral (ventral) view; F—same, carpus and chela, lateral (ventral) view.

Unesconia coibensis gen. et sp. nov., allotype, male (pocl 1.7 mm, cl 2.8 mm) from the same locality (FLMNH UF 51927): A—major (left) second pereiopod, dorsomesial view; B—same, carpus and chela with fingers closed, lateral (ventral) view; C–H—same, chela fingers opened viewed from various angles mesially (C–F) or laterally (G, H), setae omitted for clarity.
figureCitation.captionText-6: FIGURE 7. Unesconia coibensis gen. et sp. nov., allotype, male (pocl 1.7 mm, cl 2.8 mm) from the same locality (FLMNH UF 51927): A—major (left) second pereiopod, chela fingers opened viewed from various angles mesially (A–C) or laterally (D). See also Fig. 6.
figureCitation.captionText-7: FIGURE 8. Unesconia coibensis gen. et sp. nov., paratype, ovigerous female (pocl 2.1 mm, cl 3.0 mm) from Canales de Afuera, Coiba Archipelago, Panama (FLMNH UF 51928) [A–H]; allotype, male (pocl 1.7 mm, cl 2.8 mm) from the same locality (FLMNH UF 51927) [I, J]: A—third pereiopod, lateral view; B—same, propodus and dactylus, mesial view; C—same, distal portion of propodus and dactylus, lateral view; D—fourth pereiopod, lateral view; E—same, propodus and dactylus, mesial view; F—same, distal portion of propodus and dactylus, lateral view; G—fifth pereiopod, lateral view; H—same, propodus and dactylus, mesial view; I—male second pleopod, posterior (“lateral”) view; J—same, detail of appendix masculina and appendix interna, drawn without scale.
figureCitation.captionText-8: FIGURE 9. Unesconia coibensis gen. et sp. nov.: holotype, ovigerous female (pocl 2.0 mm, cl 3.1 mm) from Canales de Afuera, Coiba Archipelago, Panama (FLMNH UF 51926), shrimp alive, dorsal view. Photograph by the author.
figureCitation.captionText-9: FIGURE 10. Unesconia coibensis gen. et sp. nov., paratype, ovigerous female (pocl 2.1 mm, cl 3.0 mm) from Canales de Afuera, Coiba Archipelago, Panama (FLMNH UF 51928), shrimp alive, dorsal [A] and lateral [B] views; allotype, male (pocl 1.7 mm, cl 2.8 mm) from the same locality (FLMNH UF 51927), shrimp alive, dorsal view, right (minor) cheliped regenerating [C]. Photographs by the author.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material .
Holotype : ovigerous female (pocl 2.0 mm, cl 3.1 mm ), FLMNH UF 51926 , Panama , Pacific coast, Coiba Archipelago ,
Canales de Afuera
(channel between Isla Afuera and Isla Afuerita ), channel between small islet and northern side of Isla Afuera , 7.695249N– 81.635710W , shallow subtidal sand flat with abundance of fragmented coral rubble and living colonies of
Pocillopora
, depth:
1–2 m
at low tide, in large piece of coral rubble, presumably associated with yellowish incrusting sponge, leg. A. Anker & P.G.P. Pachelle ,
19 February 2019
[fcn PAN-99]
.
Allotype : male (pocl 1.7 mm , cl 2.8 mm , minor second cheliped regenerating), FLMNH UF 51927 , same collection data as for the holotype [fcn PAN-100]
.
Paratypes : 1 ovigerous female (pocl 2.1 mm , cl 3.0 mm), FLMNH UF 51928 , same collection data as for the holotype [fcn PAN-98]; 1 ovigerous female (pocl 1.7 mm , cl 2.8 mm ), FLMNH UF 51929 , same collection data as for the holotype [fcn PAN-97]
.

Description . Small-sized pontoniine shrimp with dorsoventrally somewhat flattened body ( Fig. 1 ). Carapace smooth, glabrous, neither setose nor pubescent ( Fig. 1 ). Rostrum well developed; dorsal carina strong, dentate, with typically four teeth, sometimes only two teeth; ventral carina unarmed; tip reaching to at least distal margin of first article of antennular peduncle, usually to end of antennular peduncle; lateral carinae proximally expanded, each side with one strong, anteriorly pointing, simple supraorbital tooth ( Fig. 2A, B , F–H). Orbit well developed; inferior orbital angle distinct; epigastric and hepatic teeth absent; antennal tooth strong, acute; pterygostomial angle distinctly protruding, acute or subacute ( Fig. 2A, B , F–H).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 1 .
Unesconia coibensis
gen. et sp. nov.
: holotype, ovigerous female (pocl 2.0 mm, cl 3.1 mm) from Canales de Afuera, Coiba Archipelago, Panama (FLMNH UF 51926): habitus, lateral view.

FIGURE 2 .
Unesconia coibensis
gen. et sp. nov.
, paratype, ovigerous female (pocl 2.1 mm, cl 3.0 mm) from Canales de Afuera, Coiba Archipelago, Panama (FLMNH UF 51928) [A–E]; holotype, ovigerous female (pocl 2.0 mm, cl 3.1 mm) from the same locality (FLMNH UF 51926) [F]; allotype, male (pocl 1.7 mm, cl 2.8 mm) from the same locality (FLMNH UF 51927) [G–I]: A—frontal region, dorsal view [left eye somewhat abnormal, i.e. smaller and partly shrunk, in the illustrated specimen (see Fig. 10B), shown as normal based on the right eye]; B—same, lateral view; C—sixth pleonite and tail fan, dorsal view; D—telson, posterior region, dorsal view; E—uropodal exopod, detail of lateral angle of diaeresis, dorsal view; F—frontal region of carapace and left eyestalk, lateral view; G—frontal region, dorsal view; H—same, lateral view; I—uropodal exopod, detail of lateral angle of diaeresis, dorsal view.

FIGURE 3 .
Unesconia coibensis
gen. et sp. nov.
, paratype, ovigerous female (pocl 2.1 mm, cl 3.0 mm) from Canales de Afuera, Coiba Archipelago, Panama (FLMNH UF 51928): A—right mandible, mesial view; B—left mandible, lateral view; C—same, mesial view; D—maxillule, lateral view; E—maxilla, lateral view; F—first maxilliped, lateral view; G—second maxilliped, lateral view; H—third maxilliped, lateral view; I—epistome, ventral view.

FIGURE 4 .
Unesconia coibensis
gen. et sp. nov.
, paratype, ovigerous female (pocl 2.1 mm, cl 3.0 mm) from Canales de Afuera, Coiba Archipelago, Panama (FLMNH UF 51928): A—right first pereiopod, lateral view; B—same, mesial view; C—same, chela, mesial view; D—same, chela with fingers opened, setae omitted for clarity, dorsolateral view; E—same, chela with fingers opened, setae omitted for clarity, ventromesial view.

subSubSection.paragraph: Both second pereiopods (chelipeds) enlarged, robust; chelae more or less swollen, unequal in size, asymmetrical in shape, moderately setose; major chela more swollen than minor chela, with very different finger armature; sexual dimorphism of major cheliped not significant. Major cheliped with ischium very short, widening distally; merus stout, less than twice as long as maximal width, ventromesial margin with small rugosities; carpus short, cupshaped; chela moderately swollen (slightly more swollen in male), surface smooth except for minute tubercles along ventral and dorsal surfaces of palm and ventral margin of pollex; fingers about half as long as palm, cutting edges with two opposing deep fossae, one on pollex and one on dactylus ( Figs. 5 A–D, 6, 7). Female minor cheliped with ischium, merus and carpus very similar to those of major cheliped; carpus slightly longer; chela much less swollen, slenderer, surface smooth, except for minute tubercles along ventral and dorsal surfaces of palm and near base of pollex; fingers subequal in length to palm, cutting edges unarmed; pollex shallowly excavated on each side of cutting edge ( Fig. 5E, F ). Male minor cheliped presently unknown (regenerating in male allotype ).

Third to fifth (ambulatory) pereiopods relatively slender, diminishing in robustness from third to fifth, similar in shape. Third pereiopod with ischium about three times as long as wide, unarmed; merus slightly swollen, with feebly convex margins, 4.5 times as long as maximal width, unarmed; carpus noticeably slenderer than merus, slightly less than half-length of merus, unarmed; propodus twice as long as carpus, slender, ventral margin with four small but stout spiniform setae, including terminal one at propodo-dactylar articulation; dactylus moderately stout, compressed, slightly more than 0.2 length of propodus; unguis slender, acute; corpus with one large distal tooth, stouter than unguis, almost parallel to unguis; ventral margin of corpus with two or three smaller articulated spinules (sometimes minute) ( Fig. 8 A–C). Fourth pereiopod generally similar to third pereiopod, but noticeably slenderer; merus not swollen, with straight margins; propodus and dactylus similar to those of third pereiopod ( Fig. 8 D–F). Fifth pereiopod slenderest; ischium almost four times as long as wide; merus not swollen, with straight margins, more than six times as long as maximal width; propodus much more slender and proportionally longer than that of third or fourth pereiopod, with two slender spiniform setae (sometimes not visible in lateral view), including terminal one at propodo-dactylar articulation; distal ventrolateral surface with four rows of serrulate setae forming propodal cleaning brush; dactylus similar to that of third pereiopod, somewhat stouter ( Fig. 8G, H ).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 5 .
Unesconia coibensis
gen. et sp. nov.
, paratype, ovigerous female (pocl 2.1 mm, cl 3.0 mm) from Canales de Afuera, Coiba Archipelago, Panama (FLMNH UF 51928): A—major (left) second pereiopod, mesial (dorsal) view; B—same, carpus and chela with fingers closed, lateral (ventral) view; C—same, carpus and chela with fingers opened, lateral (ventral) view; D—same, chela fingers opened, setae omitted for clarity, lateral (ventral) view; E—minor (right) second pereiopod, lateral (ventral) view; F—same, carpus and chela, lateral (ventral) view.

subSubSection.paragraph: Male second pleopod with well-developed appendix masculina furnished with at least six stiff setae on apex and margin opposed to endopod; appendix interna longer than appendix masculine masculina ( Fig. 8I, J ). Uropod with lateral lobe of protopod acutely produced; exopod broadly ovoid, with small distolateral tooth; diaeresis (transverse suture) abruptly curved near its lateral end, typically with five strong spiniform setae, third (most central) spiniform seta strongest and longest, sometimes with four spiniform setae; none of spiniform setae extending to exopod’s lateral margin; endopod narrowly ovoid, without specific features (Fig; 2C, E, I).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 6 .
Unesconia coibensis
gen. et sp. nov.
, allotype, male (pocl 1.7 mm, cl 2.8 mm) from the same locality (FLMNH UF 51927): A—major (left) second pereiopod, dorsomesial view; B—same, carpus and chela with fingers closed, lateral (ventral) view; C–H—same, chela fingers opened viewed from various angles mesially (C–F) or laterally (G, H), setae omitted for clarity.

subSubSection.paragraph: Colour pattern . Females: body semi-translucent, pale to more intense yolk-yellow, second pereiopod chelae lemon-yellow, walking legs and tail fan transparent with yellow tinge ( Fig. 9 , 10A, B ). Male : body and appendages, including second pereiopod chelae semi-translucent lemon-yellow; waking legs, antennae and proximal half of palm of second pereiopod chela with conspicuous white spots ( Fig. 10C ).
Etymology . The specific epithet refers to the Coiba Archipelago / Coiba National Park, which includes Canales de Afuera islands, its type locality; used as an adjective.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 7 .
Unesconia coibensis
gen. et sp. nov.
, allotype, male (pocl 1.7 mm, cl 2.8 mm) from the same locality (FLMNH UF 51927): A—major (left) second pereiopod, chela fingers opened viewed from various angles mesially (A–C) or laterally (D). See also Fig. 6.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type locality
. Canales de Afuera , Coiba Archipelago , Pacific coast of Panama
.
Distribution . Presently known only from the type locality on the Pacific coast of Panama .

Ecology . All specimens of
Unesconia coibensis
gen. et sp. nov.
were extracted from a large (about 70 cm long and 50 cm wide) dead coral head (
Pocillopora damicornis
), which was partly immerged into surrounding coarse sand mixed with smaller fragments of coral rubble, in very shallow water ( 1–2 m at low tide). The collection site was also characterised by a noticeably stronger and colder current due to the constant water flow between a small islet and the main island of Isla Afuera. The shrimps were likely associated with a yellow incrusting sponge growing deep inside the dead coral crevices; a small fragment of this sponge preserved in ethanol was deposited in the FLMNH sponge collection for further studies (FLMNH Porifera 4384). However, it must be noted that the specimens were falling out of the broken-up dead coral head, which possibly contained other incrusting sponges. The association of
U. coibensis
sp. nov.
with that particular yellow sponge was presumed based on its large extension inside the coral head and on the similarly yellow colouration of the shrimps.
